title: Inside Shangri-La Toronto hotel where George Clooney and Johnny Depp hang out
text:
52 shares 23
View
comments
For nearly two weeks every September, Hollywood’s brightest stars - and their biggest fans - descend on Toronto for one of the film industry’s most prestigious festivals.
When they aren’t striking red carpet poses ahead of world premieres, A-listers are creating a buzz at trendy restaurants, overpriced cocktail bars or the city’s high-end hotels.
One of the most popular stops on the celebrity trail is the five-star Shangri-La, where stargazers have already spotted a number of famous faces just days into the festival.
George Clooney, who reportedly stayed there while in town to promote the film Our Brand is Crisis, patiently posed for photos with fans inside the high-end hotel’s bar after braving the rain at the premiere.
Spies spotted fellow Oscar nominee Johnny Depp, another rumoured Shangri-La guest, grabbing a bite at Bosk, the hotel’s Asian-inspired restaurant.
Scroll down for video
A 'moongate' welcomes guests to the master bedroom inside Shangri-La Toronto's two-bedroom Shangri-La suite, on the 17th floor
Shangri-La Toronto is tucked between the Canadian city's entertainment and financial districts (pictured: premier king room)
A deluxe suite offered a peaceful ensuite bathroom, with stunning views of Toronto's iconic CN Tower (right)
Academy Award nominee Johnny Depp was reportedly spotted dining at Bosk, the hotel's Asian-inspired restaurant
Tucked in a prime spot between Toronto’s financial and entertainment districts, the Shangri-La has been a retreat for celebrities since it opened three years ago, and it’s easy to see why.
Thanks to the privacy they’re afforded, many famous guests have managed to go undetected while slipping in and out of the 66-storey hotel-condominium tower for work or play.

But when the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) rolls around every year, it’s not unusual to bump into a Hollywood heavyweight – such as Clooney – in the lobby lounge.
Those who don’t spot any famous faces won’t be disappointed, as guest rooms that face southwest are afforded extraordinary views of Toronto’s top landmark, the CN Tower.

For those who are looking to exercise, Shangri-La Toronto boasts a pool and 24-hour fitness room
A one-bedroom deluxe suite boasts a spacious living area with a large screen TV and an additional full guest bathroom
The hotel lobby's lounge becomes an active spot at the weekend, with guests enjoying cocktails while listening to live music
From my stylish one-bedroom deluxe suite on the 11th floor, the best views were from the deep-soaking bathtub in the ensuite bathroom.
A relaxing soak takes on a whole new level high above the rat race below, while taking in the 1,815ft tower’s spectacular LED light show – instead of a blank wall at home.
The stunning display of multi-coloured lights is visible through floor-to-ceiling windows from the swanky suite’s bathroom, bedroom and living room.
The relaxation room at Miraj Hammam Spa by Caudalie Paris, which is inspired by the ancient rituals of the Middle East
Academy Award winner George Clooney took time out of his busy schedule at Toronto's film festival to pose for photos at the hotel bar
Shangri-La Toronto has three luxury one-bedroom speciality suites - Architect, Fazioli and Zhang Huan (pictured)
The ensuite bathroom was the most peaceful spot in the entire suite, with a separate glass-enclosed shower, double sinks, a TV screen in the mirror and L’Occitane en Provence toiletries.
The only thing it lacked was speakers in the walk-in shower so that guests could listen to a TV programme – such as a morning news broadcast or evening sporting event – or music.
But that is a small detail compared with the amenities in the spacious suite, including an Apple iPad, a well-stocked minibar, Nespresso machine, 24-hour in-room dining and even a yoga mat.
With the push of a button next to the double bed, guests can switch the lights on or off, open or close the drapes and activate the do not disturb signal outside the door.
The spacious one-bedroom owner's suite has amazing city views from the master bathroom, which boasts floor-to-ceiling windows
The Shangri-La suite features a private balcony and a private butler's entrance, and can be converted into a three-bedroom suite
During the day the Health Club pool, lap pool and whirlpool have plenty of natural light with panoramic city views from cabanas
This is standard throughout the hotel’s 202 rooms and suites, which offer a contemporary and classical style that even a big budget film star would appreciate.
During TIFF, the hotel extends its bar hours, brings in live entertainment and becomes one of the places to mingle with industry types, as it’s just down the street from the festival’s headquarters and not far from Yorkville, another hotspot.
On a Friday night, Bosk was buzzing with locals who were saying goodbye to a long work week, and couples who were kicking off a romantic night out.
Serving modern Canadian cuisine, the 80-seat restaurant served a set dinner menu for CAD$45 (approximately £22), using seasonal ingredients sourced from the region.
The Bar is a busy spot at the weekend, attracting locals who are unwinding after work on a Friday or heading out to the theatre
Shangri-La Toronto, set in a 66-storey hotel-condominium tower, opened three years ago and is Toronto's 10th tallest building

Starters included a delicious fillet of lightly smoked trout (with wheat berry, cucumber and lemon crème fraiche dressing), while the mains were highlighted by perfectly prepared beef striploin with potato puree, roasted carrot, onion and mustard jus.
After dinner, my friend and I stopped at The Bar for what was supposed to be a quick drink before taking a wander through the entertainment district.
Many hotel bars are in a sad state, but this is not the case at the Shangri-La, where it’s packed with a mix of guests and locals, and there is no need to escape after one glass of Canadian rye whiskey.
To coincide with Clooney’s stay during TIFF, the bar was reportedly stocked with his own brand of tequila, Casamigos.
While there are plenty of opportunities to mingle and socialise, guests can seek privacy at Miraj Hammam Spa by Caudalie Paris.
For 45 minutes, my skin was given a once-over with a revitalising hammam, gommage and rhassoul clay body masque treatment.
After sitting in a steam room for 10 minutes, my body was scrubbed down with exfoliating gloves before the masque was applied and then removed, with the celebrity treatment leaving my skin feeling its smoothest in years.
